item.title: About me
item.description: My name is Long Wang, I am a PHD student in Dept. Mechanical Engineering, Vanderbilt University. I am working with Advanced Robotics and Mechanism Applications Research Laboratory (ARMA Lab). My research interests include continuum robots and their medical applications, modeling and calibration of robots and force controlled exploration using robots.

item.title: Me and Robots
item.description:
Robotic Hand

I started my robitics journey from junior year when I was in Tsinghua University, Beijing. One day I saw this cool robotic hand project in Dr. Wenzeng Zhang’s lab and asked him if I could work with him. He said yes, and then for the next two years, I worked with him and learned a lot from him.

After undergraduate, I decided to continue to graduate study. I had the honor to work with Dr. Peter Allen in his Robotics Lab at Columbia University. I spent almost two years there and it was exciting and very fun because we got to build a robotics hand from scratch.

Snake-like Robots (Continuum Robots)

item.title: Me and Photography
item.description: This is new for me but I enjoy learning and exploring. It is fun to capture beautiful scenery and landscape from different places when traveling. But I like it more to capture people, to seize the interesting moments in life.

item.title: Me and Trumpet
item.description:
I love listening to trumpet pieces and playing myself.

I started to play trumpet when I was young but unfortunately never able to play so well. I was playing in middle school, high school and colledge and now I am playing in community concert band.
